Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial  Appearance as to Esteban Leon-Mundo held on 3/21/2013: Present: AUSA Timothy Henwood. Govt. moved to unseal indictment. Defendant was provided with copy of the Indictment and advised as to the charges and his rights. After reviewing the CJA-23 form filled by defendant, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Defendant will be represented by the FPD's Office. Defendant ordered temporarily detained. Arraignment/Bail set for 4/4/2013 at 1:30 PM in Courtroom 10 before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. (USPO Aparicio & Irizarry) (amr) (Entered: 03/22/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance / Detention Hearings as to Maria Valentin-Aponte(34) held on 3/21/2013. Present: AUSA Timothy Henwood. Govt. moved to unseal indictment. Defendant was provided with copy of the Indictment and advised as to the charges and her rights. After  reviewing the CJA-23 form filled by defendant, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Defendant will be represented by CJA counsel. As to Detention, the Court imposed bail in the amount of $5,000.00 of which $2,500.00 shall be cash or secured and $2,500.00 unsecured to be posted by April 4, 2013. Third Party Custodian to be qualified by April 4, 2013. Standard conditions of release to include; Drug testing and /or treatment. Government had no objection. Arraignment set for 4/4/2013 at 1:30 PM in Courtroom 10 before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. (USPTO Aparicio & Irizarry) (amr) (Entered: 03/22/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Arraignment/Detention as to Joselito Rodriguez (20) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 3/26/2013. Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata, Atty. Javier Cuyar and PO Carolina Aparicio. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Judge Fuste for trial setting. As to detention, defense counsel requested a brief continuance since he still have pending to interview the defendant's family in order to obtain more information to offer to the court. The Court granted the request. Detention Hearing reset for 4/2/2013 09:00 AM in Courtroom 10 before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 02:08.Hearing ended at 02:12.Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (ft) Modified on 3/28/2013 to add atty's names (ft). (Entered: 03/28/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez:Arraignment/Detention as to Hector M. Martinez-Garcia (24) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 3/26/2013. Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata, Atty. Edgar Sanchez and PO Carolina Aparicio. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Judge Fuste for trial setting. As to detention, defense counsel requested a brief continuance since there are some issues that he would like to investigate in order to obtain more information to offer to the court. The Court granted the request. Detention Hearing reset for 4/4/2013 02:30 PM in Courtroom 10 before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 02:15.Hearing ended at 02:21.Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (ft) (Entered: 03/28/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Arraignment/Detention as to Yeidi Gonzalez-Gonzalez (44) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 3/26/2013. Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata, Atty. Manuel San Juan and PO Elsie Tofani. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Judge Fuste for trial setting. As to detention, defense counsel strongly disagreed with the recommendation of the pretrial report and requested a brief continuance of the hearing in order to further investigate the case and obtain more information to offer to the court. The Court granted the request. Detention Hearing reset for 4/4/2013 02:30 PM in Courtroom 10 before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 02:30.Hearing held at 02:39. Hearing ended at 02:46.Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (ft) (Entered: 03/28/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment and Detention Hearings as to Edwin Olmo-Rodriguez (11) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 4/1/2013. AUSA Timothy Henwood and defense counsel Jorge E. Rivera were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Detention and after hearing the parties, the Court set bond as to Edwin Olmo-Rodriguez (11) in the amount of $5,000 of which $2,500 is cash or secured and $2,500 is unsecured. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment and Detention Hearings as to Alex Maldonado-Ortega (43) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 4/1/2013. AUSA Timothy Henwood and defense counsel Mariela Maestre were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Detention, the Government proffered defendant's role as a seller, has a witness who would testify that defendant was a seller of crack cocaine, stash money in apartment and carried firearm in the housing public project. The Government moved for detention due to risk of flight and danger to the community. Defense counsel proffered that there are conditions of release that may be imposed. Defendant's uncle is willing to have defendant reside at his home, has a landline, wear an electronic monitoring device and may receive better medical treatment while on bond. After hearing the parties, the Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 03:11. Hearing ended at 03:20. Interpreter Enith Valdes. (br) (Entered: 04/02/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Detention as to Wilfredo Gonzalez-Montalvo (31) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 5/8/2013. Present were AUSA Marshal Morgan and Ms. Rosa Bonini. Defendant is present and under custody. He was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings based on his answers and the assertion made by his counsel. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions Case is referred to Judge Fuste for scheduling. As to bail, Ms. Bonini expresses the mental health problems defendant suffers from and that since he arrived to PR has not  received medication at MDC. Arguments in favor of bail heard. Defense counsel offers bail conditions, including a possible residence in PR. The Court requested both Probation as well as Ms. Bonini to verify alternatives and rescheduled further hearing for this afternoon. Further Detention Hearing set for 5/8/2013 at 01:30 PM in Courtroom 11 before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive. (Court Reporter - FTR.)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 10:34.Hearing ended at 10:52.Interpreter - Annie Flores. (yr) (Entered: 05/09/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Detention Hearing as to Wilfredo Gonzalez-Montalvo held on 5/8/2013. Present were AUSA Dennise Longo and Ms. Rosa Bonini. The parties met at sidebar with the Court and discussed the alternatives presented by Probation and defense counsel. The Court set bail in the amount of $5,000.00 unsecured with defendant's signature, he's allowed to reside with his family in Philadelphia and have courtesy supervision there as well as travel to PR for court dates, mental health treatment, curfew to be set by Probation, plus all other standard conditions of release. The Court also ordered that defendant be released from the Court as Probation had made all arrangements for defendant to travel back to Philadelphia this same afternoon and to have his family picked him up at the airport there. US Probation Meaux was present in Court to escort him to the plane. (Court Reporter -FTR.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 03:30.Hearing ended at 03:40. (yr) (Entered: 05/09/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Arraignment as to Rafael Serrano-Gras (23) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 8/12/2013. Present: AUSA Timothy Henwood and defense counsel Alex Rosa. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Carolina Aparicio also present. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to Judge Jose A. Fuste for trial setting. As to the matter of detention, the defense moves for bail. Defendant traveled from the States and self surrendered. The Government has no objection, requests that a secured amount be imposed. Court sets bail at $5,000 ($1,000 cash or secured and remaining amount of $4,000 unsecured). Standard conditions of release apply, urinalysis, drug rehabilitation treatment program, if deemed so necessary by the USPO. Third party custodian (defendant's wife or sister, to be interviewed by USPO), if there's any areas of concern then USPO 1s to file motion. Defendant cannot reside at the Turabo Heights Public Housing Project. Defense counsel to make efforts to locate family members and file motion accordingly. (Court Reporter FTR.) Hearing set for 11:00 a.m. Hearing held at 11:50 a.m. Hearing ended at 11:59 a.m. Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (sr) (Entered: 08/13/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Bond Revocation Hearing as to Marta Mercado-Rodriguez held on 10/17/2013. AUSA Timothy Henwood and defense counsel Luis A. Oliver were present. The Government informed that defendant plead guilty and pending sentencing in December. At that time, the Government had no objection that she remain on bond. Defendant continues to violate her release conditions and requested that bond be revoked based on the allegations made in the motion, 570 , filed by the Probation Officer. Defense counsel was heard by proffer and offered that defendant's daughter is willing to take her mother to her home to keep her away from the public housing. After listening to the parties and reviewing the motions, the Court finds that defendant was given a second chance and the probation officer has exhausted all attempts for defendant to comply with her release conditions. Since defendant was afforded a couple of chances and being a convicted felon, the Court hereby revokes defendant's bail for failure to comply with her release conditions. Defendant is ordered detained without bail. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 09:15. Hearing held at 09:47. Hearing ended at 09:54. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (br) (Entered: 10/17/2013)

Case 13-857 (JAF): Waiver of Indictment, Filing of Information and Change of plea hearing as to Edwin Olmo-Rodriguez held on 12/4/2013. Present: AUSA Timothy Henwood, Atty. Jorge E. Rivera. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Jose A. Fuste: Sentencing held on 12/4/2013 for Fabian Lopez-Mercado (3). Present: AUSA Timothy Henwood, Atty. Thomas R. Lincoln, USPO Sandra Velez. Defendant is U/C and present in court. No objections to the PSI Report. Defense counsel requested a credit adjustement for the time served in state court. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard. Defendant's allocution heard. The Court sentenced the Defendant to 144 months of IMPR as to Count 1. Pursuant to USSG §5G1.3(b), the intended sentence of 144 months is adjusted/reduced to 126 months and 11 days in order to credit the defendant for relevant conduct and sentences outlined in paragraph 42 of the PSI. The federal sentence, because of relevant conduct principles, must run concurrently with the state sentence; SRT of 8 yrs; SMA of $100.00; Counts 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, Dismissed. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 09:59.Hearing ended at 10:21.Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (dv) (Entered: 12/10/2013)

Defendant Miguel Villanueva Lorenzo (2) filed leave to appeal the District Courts order denying his motion for reduction of sentence pursuant to amendment 782. Defendant Villanueva Lorenzo filed his notice of appeal, pro se, on April 19, 2016, (Docket No. 1165 ) 22 days after the entry or the order that is being appealed. The notice of appeal, however, was filed within the 30 days immediately following that 14 day period provided by the Federal Rules of Appellate Procedure. Pursuant to Fed. R. App. 4(b), the Court hereby finds good cause, deeming defendant Villanueva Lorenzos notice of appeal filed on April 19, 2016, timely filed. Signed by Judge Gustavo A. Francisco Adams, and USPO Shirley Pabon. Defendant is under custody, present in court, and assisted by the court interpreter. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to William Perez-Orta (26) held on 5/22/2019. Present: AUSA Cesar Rivera and AFPD Vivianne Marrero. Defendant was present, under custody and assisted by the court interpreter. After hearing the parties, the court did not revoke defendant's supervised release. Defendant is to be released under the conditions previously imposed at sentencing and with the following modifications: 1. The defendant shall participate in transitional and reentry support services, including cognitive behavioral treatment, under the guidance and supervision of the Probation Officer. He shall remain in the services until satisfactorily discharged by the service provider with the approval of the Probation Officer; 2. The defendant shall be placed in the location restriction program for a period of six (6) months under Curfew (You are restricted to your residence every day from 6:00 PM to 6:00 AM) with EMD.The defendant shall pay for the electronic monitoring equipment at the prevailing rate in effect during the term of monitoring or in accordance with his ability to pay; 3. Defendant shall continue outpatient treatment program as arranged by the US Probation Officer. (Court Reporter Evilys Carrion.) Hearing set for 09:00. Hearing held at 09:41. Hearing ended at 09:48. Interpreter Virginia Santamaria. (sc) (Entered: 05/22/2019)

ORDER holding in abeyance 1546 Informative Motion Notifying Violations of Supervision Conditions as to Emmanuel Perez-Rodriguez (36). The Court is giving supervisee the benefit of the doubt as to the facts adduced by the Probation Officer, given that local authorities did not press charges against him. However, the fact remains that he did not report such intervention to his supervising officer. The Probation Officer will contact supervisee immediately to inform of the Court's ruling. The Probation Officer will also modify immediately the conditions of release accordingly and so inform the Court. Any further failure by supervisee to comply with his release conditions shall result in his immediate arrest, and will be considered along with the matter now in abeyance. So Ordered.Signed by Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi on 3/14/20. (Gelpi, Gustavo) (Entered: 03/17/2020)

***SEE CORRECTED COPY OF ORDER AT ECF NO. 1549 ***Certified Copy of Order from USCA as to Miguel Villanueva-Lorenzo (2) entered on 04/02/2020 re: 1531 NOTICE OF APPEAL; Upon review of the record in this case, it appears that the notice of appeal, filed on February 14, 2020, seeking to appeal the order entered on January 16, 2020, is late. The notice of appeal, however, was filed within the thirty days immediately following that fourteen-day period. The district court, upon a showing of excusable neglect or good cause, may enlarge the time for filing a notice of appeal filed within that thirty-day period. Accordingly, we transmit the notice of appeal to the district court for a ruling whether the district court will enlarge the time for filing an appeal and will consider this notice of appeal timely filed. Copies of the district court's decision shall be forwarded to this court forthwith. (Attachments: # 1 Exhibit NOA) (xi) Modified on 4/3/2020 (gmm). (Entered: 04/02/2020)

ORDER as to Joseph Sanabria-Arlequin (17). An Initial Appearance on Revocation Proceedings is set for 10/19/2020 at 03:00 PM via MEL's VTC Bridge before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. Signed by US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez on 10/19/2020. (jr) (Entered: 10/19/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance on Revocation of Supervised Release as to Joseph Sanabria-Arlequin (17). AUSA Sean Murphy and AFPD Vivian Torralbas were present. Defendant was under custody, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. Defendant voluntarily consented to the holding of the hearing via VTC. Defendant was advised of the SRT violations and his right to a preliminary hearing to determine whether his supervised release conditions have been violated or not. The Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. The Federal Public Defender was appointed to represent the defendant. The Court ordered the defendant temporarily detained. A Preliminary Revocation Hearing is set for 10/26/2020 at 09:00 AM via MEL's VTC Bridge before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. If the government intends to call a witness that is not fluent in the English language, failure of the government to timely retain the services of an interpreter may result in the imposition of sanctions. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.) Hearing set for 03:00. Hearing held at 03:30. Hearing ended at 03:35. Interpreter Carlos Ravelo. (jjr) (Entered: 10/19/2020)
